channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree root caused subsidence to wall foundation, large crack appeared, 16th February
item.description:
Footpath to All Saint's Road, Cheltenham (GL52 2QJ) Wall is also our boundary wall to a private residence. Crack appeared recently and is expanding.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, St Anne's Close, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Subsiding bridge wall, 15th February
item.description:
Three years ago today I submitted these epic tires to advise that the bridge wall on the A40/ London Road in Charlton Kings was subsiding. The inaction and current situation is well known, but progress would be ace pretty please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 267a, London Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Large pothole in nearside lane., 15th February
item.description:
Large pothole in the nearside lane on approach to the traffic lights. There is not enough room for traffic to avoid it on the nearside and is causing traffic to have to swerve into the offside lane to avoid it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Reporting what appears to be abandoned caravan, 15th February
item.description:
Caravan appeared two weeks ago. The carvan is unstable - it is unsecured and is free to (and has) tilted since it first appeared, posing a risk to passing vehicles and pedestrians. The registration plate on the caravan is for an untaxed vehicle, so was presumably towed by an untaxed car. Caravan is at the beginning of Yew Tree Close.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Yew Tree Close, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked gully at crossroads, 15th February
item.description:
Blocked gully at Queens Road / Christ Church Road junction. Been blocked for YEARS. ALL gullies around all 4 corners of this junction need a thorough clean out, as there is flooding here every time it rains, which puts pedestrians at risk of a soaking from passing vehicles which have no choice but to drive through deep standing water. Localised flooding has been a persistent issue at this crossroads for MANY YEARS. Repeatedly reported, continuously NOT resolved.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Christchurch Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken manhole chamber, 15th February
item.description:
Sunken manhole chamber in Gloucester Road, adjacent to junction with Malvern Road. Chamber is in previously resurfaced section - needs to be repaired during road closure for new resurfacing project on Gloucester Road at end of February.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 146, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked gully (blocked for YEARS), 15th February
item.description:
Gully adjacent to pedestrian crossing on A40 Lansdown Road (south side of road), close to junction with Shelburne Road. Gully fills with water and then submerged under large puddle EVERY time there is any amount of rain - floods onto crossing and pavement, and takes days to soak away / evaporate, Passing vehicles in left-turn lane can splash through standing water putting pedestrians at risk. Gully grate is not clogged, but gully is totally ineffectual in draining water from road - thorough cleaning is required, and CHECKS to make sure gully actually drains and doesn't continue to fill with water. Gullies on North side of road (to either side of pedestrian crossing) also blocked, along with several others along this stretch of A40 (from "Triumph" traffic lights to Westal Green). Have been reported many times over recent years, but none have been touched.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shelburne Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road collapsing approaching my house imperative major repairs, 15th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Potholes road disintegrating, 15th February
item.description:
Absolute mess of a patch of the road in Alma Road,Cheltenham. Road is fast falling to pices with nuerpous potholes appearing. Cars are swerving on to the wrong side of the road to avoid this patch. Not too far from the junction with Caernarvon Road and towards Windermere Road. Is very dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 60, Alma Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
